name: codeword
short_description:
Based on English language, but extensible to Romanic languages, ASCII (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASCII) standard code uses 8 bits (1 byte) to represent the most common symbols as letters  (a to z and A to Z), numbers (0 to 9) grammatical punctuation, some control characters and other symbols.

But if you want to manage words of common language as English, You will only need 26 symbols (number of no case sensitive letters in English) and maybe some punctuation symbols. Therefore to manage 26 symbols are only necessary 5 bits (2 raised to a power 5 = 32 different values).

Word “hello” -> 5 characters -> 5 bytes -> 5 x 8 bit = 40 bits. If it assigns the letter ‘a’ the value 1, 2 to the ‘b’ and so on. Then  3 first bits are useless.  Therefore it could be stored in 5 bits x 5 characters = 25 bits à 4 bytes

Applications: 
 - Compression (only text)   [a rate between 25% and 40%] 
- Searching [comparison are faster if words are lower]
summary: a simple word codification / compression algorithm
